results.Title: Community Volunteer Supplement (CVS)
results.Body:
Procedures

Community Volunteer Supplement (CVS) is a specialized caseload managed by office 583. If you require further information please contact Natalie Warren or Wendy Shewchuk.

The CVS program is no longer open to clients who are not already receiving this supplement.  No new requests for CVS should be given.  All CVS clients are to be reviewed every 6 months.  If they are determined ineligible for continued CVS, clients cannot have this decision reconsidered or reapply.

The CVS report is managed through Activities on the Case.  Only the CVS worker is to close these activities

Activities for Reviews are queried by the CVS worker and SRs are created.

CVS worker will: 

a) Mail the client notification that a review is due, along with a 2567 for completion by the volunteer agency or

b) Contact the agency from a master list managed by the CVS worker to confirm continued participation.

Once the 2567/confirmation of continued volunteer participation is received, the CVS worker will review for further eligibility, complete SR, and create a new Activity on the Case for the next review (every 6 months).

To check when the client will be due for their next review, check the Open CVS Review Activity on the Case. 

If a client has questions regarding their CVS that you do not feel able to answer, advise the client that the CVS worker will call them to follow up.  Send an email to advise CVS worker Natalie Warren.

results.Title: Drug and Alcohol (D&A) Treatment
results.Body:
​Procedures

 

 

Supported Recovery Homes - Baldy Hughes and Ksan House
Transportation - Eligible but code 53
Comforts - Eligible
Shelter Maintenance - Not eligible
Note - Baldy Hughes and Ksan House residents are not eligible for Health Supplements or Storage Fees

 

For all other licensed treatment facilities including those on reserve; clients are eligible for transportation, comforts and maintaining shelter if there are no other funding sources available.

results.Title: Eligibility Review (ER) - Appointments
results.Body:
​Procedures

Eligibility Review appointments are booked via the Eligibility Review Calendar tab on the Intake Calendar.

If a client needs to rebook or reschedule an appointment:

  • Book in the 3:00pm slot
  • Include client name, case number and phone number
  • Clients with no phone who will be phoning the 1 866# at their appointment time are to be transferred to Kristina Barnes

results.Title: Employment Plans - Waiving, Deferring and Suspending
results.Body:
​Procedures

  1. Do not create a new EP SR, update the existing Employment / Independence SR while waiving, deferring, or to suspend.
  2. Comments need to clearly articulate why we are requesting approval to waive.
  3. Drill into the Service Request and on the View Tab click Activities.
  4. Create an activity notification within the Service Request. In the description write, "Requesting Regional Adjudicator (RRA) approval to waive EP". Action By should indicate "Staff".
  5. Update the Service Office to office 500 and put Heather L Campbell as the owner (There are two Heather Campbell’s please ensure you have Heather L). 
  6. Communication from Heather is received via email and delivered to the Supervisor and EAW, who make notes within the EP SR as to decision from the RRA (who makes original notes as well).
  7. If Approved, the worker then ticks the indicator for 'EP waived' (if applicable) and adds an end date within Case/Contact/SD More Info.

results.Title: Employment Plans (EP)
results.Body:
​

Procedures
Contact Centre EAWs
1.       Client phones Contact Centre for Employment Plan 
2.       Client has no phone
·         Contact Centre EAW is to triage for completion within 583
3.       Client is a signal
·         Contact Centre EAW is to triage for completion within 583
4.       Client has phone and is not a signal
·         Contact Centre EAW will transfer call to EP task EAW
EP Team call transfers – EP task EAW available
1.       Contact Centre EAW reviews Intake Calendar Task Schedule to see which EAWs are on EP task
2.       Contact Centre EAW sends an Office Communicator message to all EP task EAWs 
3.       Contact Centre EAW transfers call to EP task EAW who can take the call
EP Team call transfers – EP task EAW not available
1.       If an EP task EAW is not available for the call, Contact Centre EAW creates an Activity
2.       If there is an active EP SR for the contact, the activity must be created on the active SR:
·         Description: EP Call Back (This is critical as this is the EP task team saved query)
·         Priority: 2-High
·         Type: Notification
·         Status: Open
·         Owner: blank (delete owner)
·         Due: 5 days from today’s date 
3.       If there is not an active EP SR for the contact, the activity must be created on the case:
·         Description: EP Call Back (This is critical as this is the EP task team saved query)
·         Priority: 2-High
·         Type: Notification
·         Status: Open
·         Owner: blank (delete owner)
·         Due: 5 days from today’s date 
Non Contact Centre EAWs
Create their own Employment Plans with clients
Profile EP
1.       If there is a bar code at the bottom of the EP, scan and ensure the document auto profiles
2.       If there is no bar code at the bottom of the EP or if it does not auto profile

·         Profile the EP to the SR at the top of the EP (Type: Employment/Independence Subtype: Employment Plan)

·         Mark the SR status as Ready

·        Use ICM to notify the owner of the EP SR

results.Title: Family and Youth Program Prince George
results.Body:
​Overview 

The Family and Youth Program is a two year Provincial Pilot and has been developed to provide a more integrated support system to young parents under age 25 with employment obligations.

In addition, Prince George has also been chosen as one of two communities, Kelowna is the other one, to work with youth in transition from MCFD programming. Partnerships are being developed with MCFD, ELMSD, Ministry of Education and Ministry of Health – Public Health Services to provide a holistic approach to service delivery for this client group.

The Young Parent Employment Obligated case list has been preselected by HQ. The youth in transition caseload will be determined via an application process managed by MCFD. There will be a requirement to report monthly on services provided and outcomes. Our Outreach Worker in Prince George, Tanya Parent will provide case management services for MSD.

The primary focus or this project is of course jobs and financial independence from IA. As part of their plan we will be assessing for barriers to employment and we will be working together to find solutions to assist in removing these barriers.  

 

Key Worker
 
Heather Kostovich 
Procedures
 

All communications (phone, drop in,) from 585FYP clients to be forwarded to Key Worker.

Messages left by clients on desk phone, cell phone, or email will be responded to within a 48 hour window.

Paperwork submitted may be processed as usual : SR, notes, scanned, filed, batched etc.

Profiling is to send notification to Key Worker.

Immediate Emergencies in the Key Worker’s absence can be assessed and actioned by any EAW or Supervisor.

results.Title: FMP - Assessment Appointment
results.Body:
Procedures​
 
All initial appointments will be booked by EAW’s.
 
EAW’s are to book an appointment into the next available time period in the FMP Assessment Calendar and inform the client of the time and contact method.

EAW’s are to ensure they have listed the client’s full name, corresponding file #, contact number or how client will contact (ie: 866#) and the name of the EAW who booked the appointment.
 
Each respondent listed by the client requires a separate appointment (ie: If the client lists 2 different respondents 2 separate appointments should be booked, preferably back to back).  

Should clients fail to attend their initial appointment all rebooking will be done by FMW’s to ensure verbal contact has been made to discuss missed appointment and consequences of non compliance with the Family Maintenance Assignment.

The client will be notified via phone or letter by the FMW as to the timing and details of their rebooked appointment.

results.Title: FMP - Assignment of Maintenance (AOM)
results.Body:
Procedures

​The Family Maintenance Assignment (AOMR) should be auto generated in ICM at the time of intake. Once eligibility has been determined any staff can witness the client signature in the first section of the 1st page.  

Staff must ensure that the AOMR is not stamped or written on other than in the specified fields. If necessary, use a cover sheet to note the applicable SR number.

EAW's are to create a Service Request in ICM for a Family Maintenance Referral. The Assignment can be scanned into ICM and should be attached to this SR.

results.Title: FMP - EA File Transfer Ins
results.Body:
Procedures
 
EAW completes the FMP Questionnaire (SD3033).
 
If the client is a suitable referral the EAW must ensure an AOM is signed and the EAW completes a FM Referral and creates a Family Maintenance Service Request in ICM.

results.Title: FMP - Family Maintenance Discrepancy Report
results.Body:
Procedures

One of the prioritized reports in Region 5 that requires action is the Family Maintenance Discrepancy Report.

EAW's are responsible for completion of this report.
 
This report identifies if clients are declaring the appropriate amount of maintenance.
 
It is important to note that this report is not always 100% accurate. If there is a discrepancy and it appears the report may be in error then the EAW can forward to an FMW for review.
 
To review the amount of maintenance that the client should be declaring per month, use the FPS L command within the GA file. 

​

results.Title: FMP - FMW Phone Calls
results.Body:
Procedures
 
Because FMW’s are completing appointments in the morning they are only available to take phone calls after 1:00pm. To determine which FMW is taking phone calls, please refer to the FMW Calendar. If you are unable to reach a FMW to transfer the phone call it is the EAW’s responsibility to create a Service Request for a message to be placed. 
 
As some names may be more common than others and EAWs are not to be placing a file # in the case field section, please attach the FM # and/or phone # in the Memo field section.
 
If a client phones in with Respondent information and no FMW is available, please document the verbal information provided on the FM file and create a SR for a FMW to return the client’s call to review the info. The SR should refer the FMW to notes on the FM file.

results.Title: FMP - FMW Signals
results.Body:
Procedures
 
FMW's are responsible for setting signals on EA files when the client is in non-compliance with FMP.
 
The FMW will contact the client via phone or letter to inform them of the signal.
 
FMP related signals on a EA file can only be released by a FMW.
 
Clients are not eligible for income assistance unless they are in compliance with FMP and signaled cheques must not be released until they are in compliance.
 
On Cheque Issue Wednesday, EAWs are permitted to use Office Communicator to identify any FMWs that may be available. The available FMWs for the day will be listed on the FMP calendar.

results.Body:

The specialized worker will complete the Service Request and use their direct fax number for paperwork.

results.Title: Investigative Officer (IO) - Reviews and Signals
results.SubCategoryValue: Prevention Loss Management Services (PLMS), Ministry Investigator (MI) and Investigative Officer (IO)
results.Body:
Procedures

Client attends office to submit paperwork requested by IO

  • Front line staff will accept paperwork and scan into the MFD to category: PLMS

For all PLMS review and signal inquiries

  • Front line staff will advise clients to contact IO to discuss submission of documents
  • IO’s direct contact number and/or PLMS toll free number can be provided to clients at any time
  • EAWs are not to resolve any PLMS signals or release benefits unless IO has specified otherwise

IO receives phone call from client

  • IO will assess client’s service needs to determine if immediate/urgent service is required

If immediate/urgent service is required

  • IO will locate documents in ICM and profile to case
  • IO will action documents and advise client of next steps/action required 

If  no immediate/urgent service is required 

  • IO will advise of standard processing times (3-5 business days) and will arrange for client to call back at later date or will confirm a contact number that client can be reached at once documents are processed

results.Title: Manager (MFS) Approvals
results.Body:
​Manager Approval Requests - All (except medical)

Manager of Field Services: Linda Herman 

Supervisor does a note summarizing:

  • What is the need
  • What is the reason for the need
  • What the client has done on their own to meet the need
  • What other resources are available or that the client has tried and no other resources are available
  • The amount requested
  • Which code applies 
    Manager Approval Requests - Medical

Manager of Field Services: Renato Mauro

  1. Retain ownership of the Service Request and leave as pending.
  2. Create notification for Manager review and approval. This only applies for medical requests as all other approvals require Supervisor review prior to being directed to the Manager.
  3. Create benefit plan which if approved will be submitted by the Manager.
  4. Manager will complete approval, submit benefit plan and change the Service Request to ready for the EAW to complete.

results.Title: Medical Task Team
results.Body:
Team Members
 
Supervisors:
Lead - Dawn Staub
Back up - Eryn Dalton
 
EAWs:
Please refer to the Intake Calendar - Task Schedule for a current list of team members and their availability.
 
ICM 

Health needs requests that come through ICM need to be profiled to the Health Supplement folder. The team will review this ICM folder regularly to manage the work.
 
Service Requests  
 
Medical Transportation - Ongoing/Follow Up 
  • Medical Task Team will create Service Request with status of pending
  • EAW reviews Notes and Activities
  • EAW completes Request for Non Local Medical Transportation Assistance (SD3320)

All other Health Supplements 

  • Service Request is created on the Contact view for the person needing the supplement
  • Medical Task Team will associate the Service Request to the appropriate case (ie: EA or HLTH)

Urgent Service Requests

Send an email to the Medical Task Team EAWs and cc the Lead Supervisors.

results.Title: Midmonth - Early Cheque Release
results.Body:
Background
 
Midmonth early cheque release is done by the home office since there are so many variables.

Some have alerts, some weeklies, some midmonth for pick-up, some for mail, some pick-up Monday, some Wednesday, some only allowed one cheque per week, some need a worker from a community agency with them, some are discretionary and some are non discretionary.

With these variables come issues of cheques being released where they shouldn’t be and we end up in a place where we are being sworn at, threatened, clients 3rd partied, etc.
 
MSD Office - Community Responsibilities
 
Dawson Creek - Chetwynd and Tumbler Ridge
 
Fort St John - Fort Nelson and Huson's Hope 
 
Prince George - Fort St James, Mackenzie, McBride, Valemount and Vanderhoof
 
Prince Rupert - Haida Gwaii and Port Edward
 
Smithers - Atlin, Burns Lake, Granisle, Hazelton, Houston, Telkwa and Topley
 
Terrace - Kitimat, Stewart and Thornhill
 
Process
 
Client calls in and the worker communicates request for release either 2 ways: 

Via communicator to Supervisor, A/S or EAW in the office:
  •  If someone is reached resolve right there. (May call to discuss etc). 
  •  If someone is not reached send an email.
 
Via email to office mailbox and CC to Supervisor:
  • Note to Case the reason for early release. Note phone number to reach client.
  • Reference Case name and Case number in the email.
  • If supervisor is out of office forward according to their out of office.
  • Person checking office mailbox should assign to an EAW or A/S when the supervisor is away and reply to all.

Advise client that if they are not contacted or they have no phone to call back in one hour. 

The person who picks up the request should try and reach the applicant to discuss.

If the client has no phone or there is no contact, the assessor makes notes of further discussion required, to release or not.

Client calls back and is given answer or put back to assessor to conclude.​

results.Title: Persons with Persistent Multiple Barriers (PPMB)
results.Body:
Procedures

Persons with Persistent Multiple Barriers (PPMB) is a specialized caseload managed by office 583. If you require further information please contact Natalie Warren or Wendy Shewchuk.

PPMB - New

Open PPMB New SOP and complete up to step 8. Complete activity “Has contact received Medical Report HR2892 form” up to and including Change SR status: Pending Sub-status: Client

PPMB worker will book appointment and send client notification.

If date/time of interview is changed by client request, update SR due date, Memo field and 583 calendar with the new date/time.  Send email to Natalie Warren to advise of change.  If client is not wanting to rebook, please advise Natalie Warren and remove appointment from calendar.  Advise client if wishes to proceed again, they will need to initiate a new appointment date and that they can use the medical report for up to one year.

If the client provides an alternate number for contact, please make a Note, add/update the Resolution field and 583 Outlook calendar.

PPMB - Review 

Reports are sent to and managed by Natalie Warren at office 583.

Medical reports do not need to be attached for the PPMB Review interview to be completed.

PPMB worker books appointment and sends client notification.  If date/time of interview is changed by client request, update SR due date, Memo field and 583 Outlook calendar with the new date/time.  Send email to Natalie Warren to advise of change. 

If client is not wanting to rebook, please advise Natalie Warren and remove appointment from calendar.  Advise client of time frames for renewal (SD More Info PPMB Review Date) and consequences should they not proceed (extended PPMB rates for 3 months, then will switch to regular).

If the client provides an alternate number for contact, please make a Note add/update the Resolution field and 583 Outlook calendar.

PPMB worker forward ready SR after interview:

  • Memo: To RRA
  • Status: Ready
  • Owner: HLCAMPBE
  • Service Office: 400
  • Due Date: 2 weeks from date of interview​

results.Title: Processing Stubs/SD81's/Monthly Report
results.Body:
Procedures

No change stubs - No comments required but drill in and review the case.

Stub with changes - No activity or note required if income recorded in ICM Income tab. Comment pay stub dates in Comments section on the Income tab.

Stubs returned to client or other information not already inputted in ICM - Add Activity to detail same then Note to record what client submitted.

results.Title: Reconsiderations
results.Body:
Reconsiderations
 
The EAW who makes the decision to reduce, deny or discontinue income assistance will be responsible for preparing the Reconsideration (HD0100) and creating a new Service Request for Reconsideration and relating it to the original decision Service Request. 
 
If after speaking with a supervisor the client wishes to proceed with a Reconsideration the supervisor will notify the EAW that an HD0100 is to be completed. 
 
If the EAW who made the decision is not available to complete the HD0100, the supervisor will assign completion of the HD0100 to a worker on the Service Request task team.
 
When the HD0100 is complete including relevant documents, worker signs and scans a copy of the complete package to the Service Request to be printed for the client when they come into the office. 
 
The person profiling the Reconsideration request will be responsible for updating the Reconsideration Service request to show the completed HD100 was received, for changing the Service Request Service Office to the Reconsideration Branch Office (Office 063) and for changing the Status of the Service Request to Ready.
 
HAB Reconsiderations
 
All HAB reconsiderations are to be completed by the Service Request Team, specifically those workers assigned to the reconsiderations task.
 
If timelines are tight then email Service Request Task Lead Leeah McClenaghan and whoever is showing assigned to SR Task #2 on the Task Schedule located within the Intake Calendar.

results.Title: START - Eligibility Reviews (ER) and File Transfer Ins (FTR)
results.Body:
​Procedures
 
The START process is only for intake for new and returning applicants.

Third party checks (3rd party checks) for reapplications on open files (annual eligibility review/add spouse to existing file/reapply from MSO) are to be done by the EAW who is conducting the review. Do not refer RAP's to the START team.

When third party checks have not been done in SSAA at intake change the icon to not started/action required so you can import the application from SSAA and then follow the Job Aid for adding a notification for checks to still be completed by the START team.

results.Title: WebAOBlink (Employment Insurance/EI) - Users, Requests and Responses
results.Body:
​Procedures

 

WebAOBlink User List

Kristina Barnes

Shannon Barnes

Ryan Challan 

Eve Johannesson

Susan Moss

Debra Parent

Tanya Parent

Jacqueline Root

WebAOBlink Requests

 

Prior to submitting a request, staff should:

  1. Ensure there is a signed 80A or 80 – MSDSI must have this signed Consent to process a WebAOBlink search
  2. Ensure there is an activity added to the Service Request indicating that a WebAOBLink search is being requested

To request an Employment Insurance claim search on a client, staff must email one of the WebAOBLink users with the following information only (no comments should be made in the email):

  • Subject Line:  WebAOBLink
  • Body Text:  Client Name, SIN & MIS PID #
 

WebAOBlink Responses

 

Upon completion of the WebAOBLink search, the SME will respond to staff via email, cc MSD WebAOBLink (MHRWEBAOBLINK@gov.bc.ca) and state the result as “See Service Request notes" or "No search results found". 

Note – the SME will scan file and profile the WebAOB report to the appropriate Service Request and then shred the report as it is not filed or batch filed any longer.

Once the WebAOBlink search has been completed and the HSD WebAOBLink mailbox has been cc’d, all local office WebAOBlink email correspondence containing client information should be deleted.

Reminder - only tax deduction on EI benefits is exempt.
